sources.data_found: Franklin Cluster (Dec 2023): Lists '9 GPU nodes' equipped with '4x A100 80GB' GPUs each.
Franklin Cluster verification: Confirms '9 GPU nodes' and 'each with 4 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs'.
Farm Cluster: Describes the 'Farm' cluster as the primary campus cluster with '~100 GPU nodes' (historical total including condo/owner nodes).
Cost Model: 'The use of the community clusters... is free of charge' (Free Tier) with opportunistic access.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count (~2,100) and Total Graduate count (~350) sourced from the CS Department Chair's 2024 welcome message. Graduate breakdown (210 MS, 140 PhD) is estimated based on a 60/40 split derived from degree completion ratios (DataUSA).

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: The older 'Farm' cluster lists 'GPU nodes' (approx 38 nodes cited in 2022 Town Hall slides, separate from Franklin) but specific card models (V100/P100) and counts per node are not publicly auditable on the current site.

gpu_resources.notes: Franklin Cluster (Verified): 9 nodes * 4 NVIDIA A100 80GB = 36 A100 80GB. Farm Cluster (Estimated): Historical documentation indicates ~38 GPU nodes, conservatively estimated as 76 V100s (2 per node), though exact inventory varies due to condo model.

compute_credits.description: UC Davis HPC operates on a 'Free Tier' model for general access (opportunistic use of idle nodes) and a 'Condo' model for guaranteed access (purchase required). There is no explicit dollar-value cloud credit program listed for general students.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI and Gemini models. OpenAI provided no data due to browsing restrictions. Gemini provided specific counts for the Franklin cluster (A100s) and estimates for the Farm cluster (V100s), as well as student enrollment figures from 2024 announcements.
